content.question: Which of the following phase changes involves the transfer of heat from the surroundings to the system?

choices.label: <math alttext="C H 4 gas, produces, C H 4 liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules in the gas phase must absorb energy in order to move closer together, thereby increasing the intermolecular attractions in the solid state.

<math alttext="C O 2 gas, produces, C O 2 solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules in the gas phase must absorb energy in order to move closer together, thereby increasing the intermolecular attractions in the liquid state.

<math alttext="H 2 O liquid, produces, H 2 O solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules in the liquid phase must absorb energy in order to create a crystalline structure with strong intermolecular attractions in the solid state.

<math alttext="N H 3 liquid, produces, N H 3 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules in the liquid phase must absorb energy in order to overcome their intermolecular attractions and become free gas molecules.

content.answer: <math alttext="N H 3 liquid, produces, N H 3 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules in the liquid phase must absorb energy in order to overcome their intermolecular attractions and become free gas molecules.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
